page.title: 14The Railway
page.content: The railway through Llanharan and Pencoed was constructed between 1848 and 1850. Llanharan Station was built in 1899. The village had been without a station for 49 years, due to opposition from a local influenintial lady who thought it would spoil the piece of the village. When it was opened, however, it enabled people to get to work in{Bridgend, Cardiff}and other outlying places. It also provided a lot of local employment. Pencoed and Llanharan stations were closed in 1964 by Doctor Beeching, the then Minister of Transport. The railway was part of the{Great Western {Railway}which was nationalised to become British Railways. From time to time there is talk of reopening stations which lie on the main South Wales to London line.
